title: Problem Overview
content: Erdős Problem #905: Every graph with n vertices and > n²/4 edges contains an edge in at least n/6 triangles. SOLVED by Edwards (unpublished) and Hadziivanov-Nikiforov (1979). Strengthens Turán's theorem: not just triangles exist above the threshold, but edges are forced into many triangles.
mathContext: Conjectured by Bollobás and Erdős. The constant n/6 is tight. See [KhNi79].

title: Graph Structure and Edge Count
content: Graph(n): structure with edges : Finset (Fin n × Fin n), symmetric and irreflexive. edgeCount(G) = G.edges.card / 2. Adj G u v ↔ (u,v) ∈ G.edges.
mathContext: Custom graph structure rather than Mathlib's SimpleGraph, using explicit edge sets for finite computation.

title: Triangle Definitions
content: IsTriangle G u v w: three distinct mutually adjacent vertices. triangleCountEdge G u v: number of triangles containing edge {u,v}. maxTriangleMultiplicity G: maximum triangleCountEdge over all edges.
mathContext: triangleCountEdge is the key quantity — the main theorem guarantees some edge achieves triangleCountEdge ≥ n/6.

title: Turán Threshold
content: turanNumber n = n²/4: the Turán number ex(n, K₃). AboveTuran G: edgeCount G > turanNumber n. turan_theorem (axiom): exceeding n²/4 edges forces a triangle.
mathContext: Turán's theorem (1941) is foundational to extremal graph theory. The complete bipartite graph K_{⌊n/2⌋,⌈n/2⌉} achieves the bound.

title: Bollobás-Erdős Theorem (SOLVED)
content: BollobasErdosConjecture: ∀ n ≥ 1, ∀ G above Turán, ∃ edge {u,v} with triangleCountEdge G u v ≥ n/6. bollobas_erdos_theorem (axiom): the conjecture holds. main_theorem_alt (axiom): alternate formulation via maxTriangleMultiplicity.
mathContext: Proved independently by Edwards (unpublished) and Hadziivanov-Nikiforov (1979). erdos_905 := bollobas_erdos_theorem.

title: Tightness of n/6
content: constant_tight (axiom): for every ε > 0, for large n, there exist graphs above Turán with maxTriangleMultiplicity ≤ n/6 + εn. The constant n/6 cannot be improved.
mathContext: Shows the theorem is optimal. The bound is achieved asymptotically.

title: Turán Graph and Properties
content: IsTuranGraph G: G is complete bipartite with balanced parts (K_{⌊n/2⌋,⌈n/2⌉}). turan_graph_triangle_free (axiom): no triangles. above_turan_creates_triangles (axiom): adding any edge to T(n,2) creates triangles via shared neighbors.
mathContext: The Turán graph is the unique extremal triangle-free graph. Adding a non-edge within one part creates triangles through the other part.

title: Proof Approaches and Key Lemma
content: Edwards' approach: counting argument summing triangles over edges. Hadziivanov-Nikiforov approach: double counting with Kruskal-Katona theorem. triangle_count_lower_bound (axiom): T(G) ≥ (e(G) - n²/4) · n/6.
mathContext: The key lemma shows each excess edge contributes about n/6 triangles. Placeholder axioms for the two proof strategies.

title: Summary: SOLVED
content: erdos_905_statement (proved): True (summary). erdos_905 (proved): BollobasErdosConjecture := bollobas_erdos_theorem. historical_note (proved): True. Problem SOLVED.
mathContext: Three proved theorems. erdos_905 directly assigns the axiom. Problem solved by Edwards and Hadziivanov-Nikiforov (1979).
